It's understandable that not everyone may be interested in ancient artifacts or history, as everyone has their own unique interests and passions. However, it's important to note that the study of the past can actually provide valuable insights and lessons that can be relevant to our lives today.

By understanding the successes and failures of past civilizations, we can learn from their mistakes and apply this knowledge to improve our own societies. For example, studying the history of conflicts and wars can help us understand the causes of conflict and how to prevent them from happening in the future.

Additionally, exploring ancient artifacts and history can be a way to broaden our horizons and expand our understanding of the world. It can expose us to new cultures, languages, and ideas, which can help us develop greater empathy and understanding for people from different backgrounds.

Overall, while ancient artifacts may not be directly useful or relevant to every person's life, the study of history can open our minds to new perspectives and ideas that can be applied to a variety of contexts.
